intro: Aeollanthus holstii, commonly known as the Holst's aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. It features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
